title: 110_hr5523
content: The "Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008" amends the 1986 Code to impose a license fee on internet gambling operators. This Act aims to regulate and tax internet gambling activities. Each licensed Internet gambling operator must pay a 2% fee on all funds deposited into betting accounts monthly. The fees collected are deposited into the Treasury's general fund as revenue and cannot be deducted from betting amounts. The Internet gambling license fee is considered an excise tax for administrative purposes. Additionally, a new section is added regarding information returns for persons subject to special provisions. "New section added for information returns of internet gambling operators under SEC. 6039J." Every Internet gambling operator subject to section 4491 must provide specified information to the Secretary, maintain appropriate records, and furnish required information such as operator details, customer information, winnings, wagers, losses, tax withheld, and account balances. Every person required to make a return under subsection (a) must provide beginning and end-of-year account balances, amounts deposited and withdrawn, and furnish a written statement to individuals with required information by January 31 of the following year. The table of sections for internet gambling operators is amended to include a new item. The amendments apply to wagers made after December 31, 2008. Additionally, withholding from certain gambling winnings is addressed. The amendments address withholding from certain gambling winnings, specifically net internet gambling winnings exceeding $5,000 in a calendar year. Definitions for net internet gambling winnings are provided, including amounts withdrawn from an internet gambling account. The amendment defines net internet gambling winnings as gross winnings from internet wagers minus the amount wagered. It also includes provisions for backup withholding on these winnings. The amendment made by this section applies to wagers placed with a licensee after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4. WITHHOLDING OF TAX ON NONRESIDENT ALIENS. Tax on Nonresident Alien Individuals is amended to include net Internet gambling income. Certain gambling winnings exemption is expanded to include wagers placed over the Internet. Withholding of tax on nonresident aliens now includes proceeds of net Internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year. The amendments made by this section apply to wagers placed with a licensee after December 31, 2008. SEC. 5 amends the tax on wagers, making persons liable for tax on wagers placed with unlicensed individuals. The territorial extent includes wagers placed within the US by US citizens or residents. These amendments apply to wagers made after December 31, 2008.
